index=`gmc_summary_index` search_name=splunk_internal_web_access_idx_summary_tracker | fields _time User Splunk_Instance App OS_Name avg_spent Dashboard_Name Latest_Access | `get_instance_roles(Splunk_Instance)` | `get_shcluster_label(Splunk_Instance)` | `get_dashboards_info(shcluster_label,app,Dashboard_Name)` | search shcluster_label="$shcluster_label_tok1$" Splunk_Instance="$Splunk_Instance_tok1$" Splunk_Roles="$Splunk_Roles_tok1$" App="$app_tok1$" Dashboard_Name="$Dashboard_Name_tok1$"

index=`gmc_summary_index` search_name=splunk_internal_scheduler_jobs_idx_summary_tracker | fields _time search_name Splunk_Instance Savedsearch_Name App User Scheduled_Time Dispatch_Time Priority Window_Time Run_Time Result_Count | `get_instance_roles(Splunk_Instance)` | `get_shcluster_label(Splunk_Instance)` | `get_saved_searches_info(shcluster_label,App,Savedsearch_Name)` | search shcluster_label="$shcluster_label_tok2$" Splunk_Instance="$Splunk_Instance_tok2$" Splunk_Roles="$Splunk_Roles_tok2$" App="$app_tok2$" Savedsearch_Name="$Savedsearch_Name_tok2$"
| stats count by Splunk_Roles | rename Splunk_Roles AS Splunk_Roles1
| stats count by Splunk_Instance | rename Splunk_Instance AS Splunk_Instance1
| stats count by app | rename app as app1
| stats count by author | rename author as author1
| stats count by Days_Latest_Access | sort Days_Latest_Access | `get_latest_access_human(Days_Latest_Access)`
| stats count by Days_Latest_Access | sort Days_Latest_Access | `get_latest_access_human(Days_Latest_Access)`

table.title: Post-process searches or Base Searches: It is highly recommended to use this feature. Follow the example here: https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/latest/Viz/Savedsearches

search.query: | eval search=mvdedup(mvsort(search)) | `get_latest_access_human(Days_Latest_Access)` | fields shcluster_label app sharing acl_perms_read acl_perms_write title label Days_Latest_Access_Display Latest_Access description type dashboard_size author location updated Report_Reference Dashboard_Reference Lookup_Reference Datamodel_Reference Macro_Reference Index_Reference Sourcetype_Reference Source_Reference Eventtype_Reference Rest_Reference BaseSearch search emp_* | stats values(*) as * dc(search) as Num_Searches count by shcluster_label app title | eval search = mvindex(search, 0, 4) | eval #=1 | table # shcluster_label app sharing acl_perms_read acl_perms_write title label author emp_name emp_ttl emp_dep emp_lob emp_type emp_status Days_Latest_Access_Display Latest_Access description type dashboard_size location updated Report_Reference Dashboard_Reference Lookup_Reference Datamodel_Reference Macro_Reference Index_Reference Sourcetype_Reference Source_Reference Eventtype_Reference Rest_Reference BaseSearch Num_Searches search | `rename_common_fields` | `rename_identity_fields` | `rename_reference_fields` | `rename_dashboards_fields`
| stats count AS "Number of Dashboards" by author | sort 0 - "Number of Dashboards"

panel.title: 5. Number of Dashboards By Employee LOB

search.query: | stats count AS "Number of Dashboards" by emp_lob | sort 0 - "Number of Dashboards"
| eval search=mvdedup(mvsort(search)) | stats values(search) as search dc(search) as Num_Searches count by shcluster_label app title | table search | rename search As "Dashboard Searches"

panel.title: 7. Top N Most Used Dashboards Over Time

search.query: | stats count by Splunk_Roles | rename Splunk_Roles AS Splunk_Roles1
| stats count by Splunk_Instance | rename Splunk_Instance AS Splunk_Instance1

chart.title: | timechart limit=0 dc(user) by label useother=false" / Most Used Dashboards In Time Period : "| stats latest(_time) AS latest_access_time dc(user) as "# of Users" values(user) as user values(label) as label count by view app

search.query: | timechart useother=f fixedrange=f usenull=f limit=0 $span_period$ dc(User) As Num_Users by $split_by_tok_1$ where max in top$top_tok2$

| search cron_schedule!="" | top cron_schedule_described | rename percent as %

search.query: | stats count by Splunk_Roles | rename Splunk_Roles AS Splunk_Roles1
| stats count by Splunk_Instance | rename Splunk_Instance AS Splunk_Instance1
